Reviews.Title: “A last resort resort”
Reviews.Author: Winwin008
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the banana bay resort with my fiancé to celebrate our engagement and my getting a new job. I was trying to find a reasonably priced place to stay as I was booking this sort of last minute and most places in town were either booked or out of my price range. The resort looks like and appears to have been a decent place years ago and the ownership has neglected the place as it is pretty run down. The place was clean on the outside but on the inside the rooms had old carpeting and the bed seemed old as well. The room we stayed in, room 112 had a slight roach problem. This was a problem. I asked for a different room and was told they were booked as it was st patricks day weekend and spring break. Asides from the roach problem the continental breakfast was served in the tv room and that room was not very clean either. Luckily I packed my own bug spray and repellent. This place would be great if the ownership put the money into it and give it a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “web site needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Christine G
Reviews.Content: Don't book this place according to web site. Upon signing in and going to room, the rooms we reserved 2 months in advance were not available. 2 double beds for people almost 6 feet tall. Room #101 smelled like urine and vomit. Had to buy air freshner and clorox clean-up, did not help. Carpet was so filthy our feet turned black on the way to the shower. Mattress was little better than a bale of straw and just as noisy. Had to sit just right on toilet seat or you risked falling off. Did not even have bag for dirty clothes. Brochure says they like it quiet and hope we appreciate it. Thats why we picked this place, no one under 16. But........come 10:00 at night the drunk 20somethings get taxied in to continue the party, and get taxied out at 3:00 a.m.Woke us up every morning as they left. No access to water, no chess set, no complimentary newspaper, no complimentary robe. 2 assets to this place. Crystal, at the front desk who checked us in and felt awful about not having the right rooms for us, and the manatee my husband saw in the canal on our second day. Cannot recommend this place for any reason, will definitely never come back here. We have relatives in Key West so we will probably come back. Web site needs updating, rooms need thorough cleaning, surprised board of health has not shut them down. Did not even see a vacuum cleaner with the maids. Off our list and we will make sure our friends and family know not to go here.

Reviews.Title: “TRANQUIL”
Reviews.Author: jim r
Reviews.Content: Clean and well kept. secluded hideaway, very peacefull with no children running around. Nice pool, the beach area is nice but not for swimming. Grounds are very nice and well maintained. A little far to walk to Duvall street but the Trolley stop is right across the street. I would go gthere again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: WheninR0ma
Reviews.Content: Banana Bay Resort & Marina was a peaceful stay in Key West at a reasonable price. They offer free parking, a pool, a hot tub, a gazebo, and lounge chairs by the water (though I don't think you can swim in the water, only in the pool, and the pool was very cold). I never saw the Tiki Bar open, but I was only there one night. The walkway to my room was not scenic, but once inside the room, the accommodations were fine and the balcony overlooked the pool and water. Guests must be over 16, so it was quiet with no children. And the continental breakfast was fine. The front desk recommended taking cabs to and from historic Old Town rather than driving/parking, which was under $9 each way and very easy. Overall, I had a nice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, No Bed Bugs, Great location and helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: johnlearned
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay here after reading some of the negative reviews. There are more positive reviews than negative reviews so I rolled the dice and was delighted with our choice. Considering the price in this area, I wasn't expecting the Taj Mahal but it was still very nice. A little tired in a few places but nothing to complain about. The only complaint I have is that there is no WIFI in the rooms, but not a big deal. I'm glad I stayed here and saved some money. If I ever head back to key west I'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Nancy-SC
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Banana Bay. It is an "adult only" property an so peaceful at the pool and under the palm trees with no crumb crushers screaming and running around. The drive to Duval Street or the beach is short. The staff is friendly and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “We Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Mark C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific time. The pool area and bayside seating were excellent. The breakfast was fine. The facility was guiet at night and well maintained. We suggest that the hotel offer bikes for their guests' use. Additional enhancements would be a shuttle that is either scheduled by guests or perioidcally runs downtown and to the airport; and perhaps making several kayaks available for use in the Bay. Finally, since you have a Tiki bar, why not staff it - at least on Friday and Saturday evenings?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, economical, comfortable, but needs attention”
Reviews.Author: GoingPlacesBostonMA
Reviews.Content: I so want to give this property four stars, but I can't because of the attention needed to update or spruce up the rooms. If you want a lovely, quiet atmosphere on the water at a very reasonable price, you should stay at Banana Bay........ but only if you can live with less than pristine conditions in your room. There are signs of wear from the humidity, and the cleaning staff could pay more attention to vacuuming. That being said, I asked for a room with a water view and was given a lovely, spacious room, with a king canopy bed. You won't find a room this size with additional seating area inside the room and a balcony with seating outside, in the downtown area anywhere near this price. We were very comfortable in our room, which also had a small fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. Upon our arrival, the toilet was running, so I called the front desk, and maintenance was there to fix it within five minutes. A request for washcloths was met immediately, too. The included breakfast was the usual buffet, and there was seating inside and outside. My favorite experience was taking a stroll along the water after dark, sitting in the gazebo, and swinging in the hammock swing, enjoying the glow from the pool area and the surrounding mini lights. Do bring your own wine, though, as the bar wasn't open during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not going back”
Reviews.Author: TaylorMN
Reviews.Content: Dirty, out dated, smelly, and black cats were sitting in front of the entrance door. I would only recommend this place if you need a bed to sleep in with no other accomidations. The landscaping was not kept up to par. Definitely needs more maintenance. Great location, needs better management.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort with excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: joeywhineray
Reviews.Content: Room King size bed with canopy, TV and bathroom. We had a balcony overlooking the pool/beach which was lovely. Fridge and sink. Really great condition of room so not sure why others have had such a bad expereince. Resort The pool was cold but that was refreshing in the sunshine tho a lot of the US guests were complaining it was too cold! Breakfast was free and good, bagels, waffles, cereals. Wifi is sporadic and only in certain areas, because we were staying near the breakfast room, we were able to get it in our room but I donâ€™t think this was standard. There is a gym. The receptionists (especially Alex) were really nice and always made good recommendations. We even stayed an extra night. There is a Tiki Bar advertised, however this was never open when we were there which was disappointing. So we bought some drinks form a store across the orad and kept these in our fridge. The resort is really quiet at night as everyone must go into town Location Is about a 10 minute drive into town (where parking is really expensive!). You can get a bus from outside the hotel which is cheap but they only come every hour and half. Cab was $10. So much to do in town that we were there every evening. There are fast-food restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “clothing optional wish it was”
Reviews.Author: neil r
Reviews.Content: the reason I booked this hotel was because I was told by there staff both the toll free main line and there cleaning staff that it was clothing optional well they let you go nude till someone prud complains it is not right that the non nudist wins if people dont like it why do they go to a hotlel like this and key west is a place for open minded people but as allways there are people who spend there time telling others how to live I say stay home and dont try to tell me to beleve the way you do

Reviews.Title: “Tired neglected hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkmorton1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean but the room and grounds were tired. The rooms are in need of renovation and updating. The wall paper is coming off in the bathrooms, the taps and toilet drip constantly. The TV is old and tired. The bed had a mosquito net which was yellow with age. The windows and patio doors do not open without significant effort and the refrigerator door would not totally close. It is an excellent location and could be so nice if more professionally managed and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting the worst.. but was pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia0624
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of what people said.. i was a little nervous! It wasn't enough to make me change my mind, because typically we are on vacation, we don't spend much time in the room. The room was always cleaned. The hotel property was clean. The pool was nice, and I loved the jacuzzi! The breakfast they offered was enough to fit anyones appetite. Cereal, muffins, bagels, and even a waffle machine to make hot waffles! It may not have been right on the strip, but for us, it was only 4$ a person downtown in the taxi! We walked to Smathers beach... and theres tons of vendors on the beach to eat. The hotel is also located near a liquor/beer store, and Checkers (fast food) which is super affordable. This was an adult only hotel, so no annoying kids! Everyone working seemed so friendly and laid back. I will def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: KDHawaii
Reviews.Content: the room is awesome however it has moldy smell. There were some ants on the kitchen counter. The bathroom is in a very bad shape. The wallpaper is peeling off. The bathroom faucet is leaking. The shower curtain got tons of molds. The mattress was very uncomfortable. It hasn't been replaced in ages. The pool/spa is awesome. It is right by the beach which is a big plus. They do allow pets. That is the main reason we stayed there. If they fix these problems, I would come back and stay a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Key west - hang out”
Reviews.Author: Bee C
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and in a lovely location. Our room looked out over the water and was very pretty. The room itself was very tired and needed some re decortation. It didn't feel too bad but could have been made nicer with a lick of paint and a new bedspread. The breakfast was fab though and free and a great start to the day. We enjoyed out visit to the Keys and this hotel didn't spoil it. The parking was fine but the reception area was hard to find somehow for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinji1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our second time already in Key West. The place is nice, prices are ok. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. From our last visit the breakfast room looked better, with the addition of a juice machine and a DIY pancake gizmo (GREAT) Not far away from main places of interest. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: bill e
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews, most good, some bad. I guess any place will get that. you can't please everybody! I am sure some have reasonable gripes, but most i have seen are people thinking they are getting a 5 star resort for the 2 star's they paid for.You get what you pay for, and this place far exceeds what you pay for! Awesome view, great people, good times, clean room, awesome pool., etc. I give it 5 stars based on value for the buck, great staff, quiet with no kids, my room was very clean and tidy, the most relaxing place i have stayed at. If you do not have kids or are not bringing them i highly recommend this place! I will be back! Oh i forgot to mention about the people who complain about peeling paint, etc, go to any sea side resort and you will see the same! Salt water is very corrosive, that is a part of paradise that will never change, if you do not agree then you do not belong in Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Waiting to be knocked down”
Reviews.Author: mvpphoto
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Banana Bay several times before and have always had a pleasant time. Unfortunately, the owners have decided to let this place fall apart bit by bit until they can knock it down to build something new. Our first room did not have a functioning bathroom (toilet was not fastened to the floor and sitting in the middle of the bathroom and could not be fixed until the next day). Our second room looked like there had been spring breakers there for about a month. Curtain was only half attached to the rod, bottom half of the bed could not be sat on because the frame was broken, water stains down the wall from the leaking fire sprinkler, mold and stains in the bathroom, hot and cold water lines were connected backward in the shower, just to mention a few. The manager offered to move us again to the only other room she had. This room was so bad that it made the one we were in look like a 5 star resort. The desk staff and manager were very professional, but had to work with the mess of a hotel that they were given. This was a great disappointment for us, as this used to be a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Afwasflop
Reviews.Content: Good service at the reception. After two days of rain the breakfast room was flooded and we had to take breakfast outside - in the rain. The room was okay and had a nice view on the pool and the beach. Noisy AC in the room. The small beach looks nice but can't be used for swimming in the sea. We had a pleasant stay, but next time I'll try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a mixed property and our mixed reactions!”
Reviews.Author: Fltravelinggal
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this place for my recent birthday. Sweet. He specifically wanted a patio and wanted to be on the water. We did get both. I liked the size of the room and the king sized bed. The bathroom was small. The decor had been nice once. I liked the inclusion of a writing desk with chair, the kitchenette, and a sitting chair. We both loved the patio. It had 2 chairs and a table. And, it had a view of the water. The grounds/pool area maintenance is very good and superior to that of the inside units. The unit itself is in Big need or "re-freshing". It needs a good scrub; but , it also needs paint and re-finishing of the wood or upholstery. Sad to have let this place go. It could be so nice. The bathroon just needs to be re-done totally. We both loved the outside area. There is a nice pool, a gazebo, a Tiki bar, and plenty of armchairs for the view. We enjoyed watching iguanas. We also enjoyed the Continental breakfast. We would probably book here again. We hope that the management will invest some interest into the property. It deserves it.

Reviews.Title: “Another peaceful stay....”
Reviews.Author: BeachLiz
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at Banana Bay, and it was yet another uneventful stay. It's nothing fancy, but then again I'd prefer to spend my money on entertainment rather than a five start resort. Pleasant and pleasing staff, as usual. No loud guests, no dirty room, no bugs....my only complaint would be that they had a "towel issue" while we were there and I had to go searching for towels on a couple occasions. The room would be cleaned but no towels were left; they apparently send their towels out to be cleaned and sometimes have delivery delays of some sort. I didn't see any topless/nude guests at the pool but would not have cared if I did. I stay at this resort because it is kid free, and I don't want to hear any whining or crying kids on my vacation. I'll take naked adults ANY day over unruly kids! LOL!! Oh, and my bunny friend was still there. S/he lets me get so close and then runs away--such a cutie!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SarBear26
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Banana Bay resort. The location is fantastic, they have a huge pool right on the water, and the room was large and very comfortable. It is nothing fancy, but perfect for a weekend away. We brought bicycles with us and traveled everywhere by bike, as it was just a quick ride to Duval St. Pets are allowed at this resort but there was no obvious pet mess anywhere, and children under 16 are not allowed so it was a quiet stay, and nice to enjoy the company of other adults at the pool without children running around. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unprepared, Messy, and HOT; Will NOT go back”
Reviews.Author: Leah S
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: 1.5 hour wait after check in for room, 90-100 degree tempture room (broken AC), No Sheets on "FINISHED" beds, Unclean bathrooms, No service for "provided" towels, and Staff not avaliable 24 hours WHAT HAPPENED: A few friends and I (3 people) stayed at the Banana Bay Resort. We picked it because it was affordable and had good reviews, or so we thought. We were told that check in was at 3:00pm, which seemed fine. And after waking up at 5am and walking around Key West all day, all we wanted to do was check in, and go lounge by the pool. So we arrived just after 3pm and checked in. We all went up to the room to discover; none of the beds were made, there was still trash on the floor, and there were no towels, toiletrees, etc. We saw the maids cart a few doors down, and figured she wasn't done. But like I said, check in was 3pm and it was after that. We went back to the office, and they told us it should have been ready and to wait while they could see if there was another room avaliable. It took 1.5 hours before they told us that our original room was now ready. Tired we took the original room and walked back to the room. When we opened the door to the room, it was over 100 degrees in the room. We turned on the AC and the ceiling fan, hoping after we came back from the pool it would be cool. In all the paperwork for the hotel it said they provided towels at the tiki bar by the pool for guests. We went down to the pool and there was no one at the tiki bar. We waited for over 15mins and no one came. One person in our group had to go back to the room to get our own towels. We were in the pool for 1/2 hour before anyone showed up at the tiki bar. We later lounged out by their beach (the only good part of the hotel) for about 2 hours. When we went back up to our room, it had cooled down some. Instead of 100 it was now 90. The AC was working, we could feel cold air coming in, but the room wouldn't cool down. We were leaving to go out to a few bars, so we figured, "hot day, its just taking a little longer to cool the room" and proceeded to get ready. I went to take a shower. The bathroom had tissues all over the floor, once that was cleaned up, I looked at the faucet (which side was hot, which was cold). I turned it to cold (remember the room is 90 or so) and very very hot water came out and the shower head was pointed outside of the tub. The floor became a large pool of hot water before I had a chance to turn it off. After that fiasco, we went out. We came back several hours later, to a still 90 degree room. By then the office had been closed and there was nothing we could do. The AC was useless and the ceiling fan didn't throw off any wind at all. I pulled the duvet off my bed and started to get read to try and sleep when my friend discoved, the maid (who we waited 1.5 hours to finish cleaning our room) and never put sheets on her bed. They put the duvet cover on all nice and neat, but not the sheets!!!! I had to give my top sheet to her to put down of the matress. With the heat and the horriable bed, needless to say it was not a pleasent night. We woke up early and went to their "continetal breakfast", not very good, a few muffins, bagels, and cereal. No fresh fruit. When we checked out I complained about the conditions that we had to stay in that we paid for. Needless to say $40 was knocked off the bill because of the 1.5 hour delay but not for the no sheets on the bed, and sauna like room, and dirty bathroom. We should have been paid to stay there! Do not be fooled by other reviewers, this was a horriable, unprofessional hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising On Website for their Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harley19582
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a vacation to Ft. Meyers FL not happy with the waters so booked a two day trip to the Keys ( our first) did alot of research for a motel that was affordable and had the accomadations we were looking for mainly a beach with clear water. Thought I had found it with this resort but when we arrived VERY BIG DISSAPOINTMENT BIG HUGE was waiting for room to become available so went around to check out the grounds and WHAT A SURPRISE AND SHOCK a very small really small beach area and a wall drop off to the water really didn't seem to mention that on your web site Did Ya? So I did not check in and told them false ads and they still charged me for the night. I will fight this but listen people do not stay here do not!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: chrisMiddlengland
Reviews.Content: located directly on the sea front. spacious, quiet room with balcony, nicely decorated. comfortable bed, fridge, coffee maker and air conditioning worked. only two small drawbacks: it rained during the night, so the outside chairs were wet and there weren't enough chairs inside to sit down for breakfast and wireless is only available in the communal room. if you don't mind neither, it's a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic affordable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: branger
Reviews.Content: It is true that this property is in need of some updating. Rooms had evidence of previous water damage. It is Florida and humidity is a problem. The room's AC was strong and the room stayed cold. Ceiling fans kept the air moving. Having a fridge and a microwave in the room was handy. I checked for evidence of bed bugs and found none. Mosquitos did enter the room and our travel companions in the next room did suffer a few bites. They initially thought bed bugs but realized it was the mosquitos. The beach area was small and quiet but not for swimming. The pool was clean. The Tiki Bar had irregular hours. Work it to your advantage. Liquor stores are close by. Make your own drinks and save even more money. The continental breakfast was basic but there were plenty of choices. If you are looking for an affordable budget type property, this will fit the bill. If you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere and prepare to pay more. This placed offered the best deal for the dates we were staying. We were on the cheap and this fit the bill completely. The staff was very friendly and eager to please. The pool area is "clothing optional." Only saw a couple of topless sunbathers and it wasn't at all objectionable. Free internet only available in the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, will be back”
Reviews.Author: TinaRodriguezLafoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June 17-20 for a short weekend trip. After reading mixed reviews, I was a little nervous but we went anyway. I know that some people have much higher expectations than I do, so we took the chance. We arrived on check-in day at 1:30 PM, check in is not until 3:00 PM, but our room was ready and they got us right in. The rooms are very nice and big. We had a basic room with king canopy bed, bathroom and a kitchenette. Room also had a balcony overlooking the pool. It is not a new hotel, so yes, the room does need some remodeling work. New paint, carpet, etc. But everything worked fine (TV, A/C, plumbing) and we were not dissapointed at all. Only had one incident of our room key not working, but we took it to the office and it was immediately replaced. You just have to keep it away from all cell phones, wallets, credit cards, etc. which is what we did after it was replaced. The pool has a Tiki Bar that was open from about noon to 6 the entire weekend. Decent drinks, average price. It's nice to have that available at the pool. The beach area is nice, lots of chairs and shade on the water. You can watch the sunset from here in comfort. Continental breakfast was basic, but free so who's complaining? WiFi is not in all rooms, but you can get in the common room and some people were able to access by the pool. If you are looking for a "fancy" hotel and lots of amenities, don't stay here. But if you are looking for a comfortable place to stay, away from the partying but not to far, this is it. We were able to take a cab to Mallory Square for $10 with tip, same on the way back from Duval Street. Cost of the cab really beats a DUI. We really enjoyed our stay for the price, and would definitely come back here when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible and never again”
Reviews.Author: SandraEN
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay there because of the cheap "romantic getaway package" that is offered on the website". Sounds fabulous huh? Not so much. We never received our "welcome drink" The graphic designer they hired to make the website was the only thing they spend money on. We check in and go to our room...it isn't done. All of the furniture was on top of the bed...assuming they were done cleaning. The office gives us another room. We arrive in a different room and it was horrible. The wallpaper in the bathroom is falling down, one piece was missing, the walls were dirty, around the toilet was moldy, the sink was backed up and if you are overweight, you have to turn sideways to use the shower (very small). The wall near the "bar" were filthy, sink was leaking, plug didn't work for coffee pot and the same for the bathroom. We waited 2 days for them to replace the plugs. The air condititioner leaks onto the TILE FLOOR on the patio...beware of trying not to fall and were cracked with water underneath. Because of the air conditioner was leaking on the floor, the wall was absorbing the water...mold?????? Bed was ok, if you like them hard. Pool...was clean and warm. Hot tub..boiling. Floor around the pool was dirty until they decided to clean it on friday. I don't advise to lay underneath coconut tree...may get killed and Tiki Bar NEVER OPEN. In the end, will NEVER stay there again and never received a credit for the hassle of the plugs not working. When you pay $600, you expect a nice place, more extremely disappointed. PS- The locals hang by the pool to see topless women and they eat the "continental breakfast" every morning....and they check your room card?? Right!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Place ..Awsome staff.. great Value ..”
Reviews.Author: MarkOatsvall
Reviews.Content: I almost didnt stay due to the Bad reviews. Glad i gambled , Great Pool , Super Nice rooms , There is NO BEACH here , But there is no beach anywhere on the north side of island .. Great atmosphere, Friendly staff. Breakfast, weekend Tiki Bar , Iguanas live on property ..Will defiantly stay here again . See my pics ! Thanks Davina

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful private secluded beach.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFoodie1
Reviews.Content: At the entrance to Key West sets this very tranquil but comfortable resort. It has the most secluded private beach with hammocks, chairs, wedding gazebo, trees, and seclusion. The Tiki bar serves up tropical cocktails. At night the pool comes alive with soft LED lights of various colors. The accommodations are a combination of private villas along an inlet and a couple stories of rooms. There is a dolphin sightseeing tour that leaves from the property. It is also one of a handful of adults only resorts in the Keys. Meaning the pool is all topless. It is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SunSandSeaMargaritas
Reviews.Content: Tuesday - On arrival checked in and reception seemed quite nice. Drove round to the room and the outside seemed a little tired. Out deluxe room itself was quite large. Chairs and table out on balcony were covered in leaves and had obviously not been cleaned in a while. There were only enough towels for one person and the hangers did not fit in the brackets in the cupboard. In the evening we went to check out the Tiki bar by the pool. It was deserted. Noboby around at all and we found out subsequently that the bar only opened on the weekend. Pool area was okay but no towels to be found. The shower in the room could not be adjusted and only scalding hot water came out of it. Wednesday - Went to get breakfast in the breakfast room. Fairly basic continental style selection of food and drink. Only sofas and armchairs available to sit on inside. If you wanted to sit and eat your breakfast you had to go and sit at the outside table and chairs. Room had a funny smell because of the aircon I think. That same evening the toilet in the room overflowed. Tried to call front desk only to find that reception closed at 10pm. Very bizarre!! Had to mop up the mess (luckily only water) with towels. Thursday - after going for a swim in the evening we came back to the room in swimsuit and towel only to find that the key card would not work. Of course no one at front desk. Eventually found a security man to let us into the room. In my opinion this hotel is not a RESORT hotel. No one at front desk after 10pm is madness. What happens in an emergency. Supposedly an adult only hotel but there was a family with two young children staying whilst we were there. When checking out we told the girl at the front desk about the problems that we had had but she seemed unaware and seemed not bothered. No apologies. judyt said it was not possble to give a discount as we had prepaid. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The photographs on the website do not represent the current condition of the property at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: kalifa282003
Reviews.Content: ok, where to start?. I decided on this hotel because most hotels in Key West and the key areas were sold out. Also, compared to regular hotel rooms in Key West this was a bargain. And i thought since we were staying only one night, this hotel would do... BAD mistake!. I had read the mixed reviews on this hotel and i did not expect a luxury hotel, but this was ridiculous. I went with it against my better judgement. This hotel has seen better days... years ago!!. The hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. The room was old and tired, the bathroom very outdated and small, no central AC but a wall unit, the carpet was old and stained. I would NOT walk barefoot at all in this room. They say in the website ( i booked through Expedia) that the room had a queen size bed. It didn't. That was a full size bed to me. The mattress was terribly uncomfortable, cheap, you can definitely feel the springs in the mattress as you toss and turn. We were really dissappointed because we went to celebrate a bday and this just put a damper on things. To top it all off, the TV did not have a remote!. And get this: i was tying to cal the front desk to complain, but the phone in our room was not working!!!. Since we were just staying there for a night, we decided to make the most of it and go to the pool area. This is actually the only good thing about this hotel, The pool area was nice setting, with a small and quaint beach area, tiki bar ( although the tiki bar closed at 5:30). WTF? The pool and hotel is addults only which is always a plus in my book (no screaming kids by the pool). But beware it is clothing optional pool, which its ok with us. The bartender was nice guy, the drinks he mixed were ok, but he was nice enough to recommend a restaurant in Key West for dinner which was excelent!. Before we head out to dinner, i stopped by the front desk area (which closes at 7-8 pm) and told the front desk girl our TV in the room had no remote, and that i was trying to call her from the room but the phone in our room was not working either. She just kinda shrugged and said she would "leave a TV remote by the front desk area" for us when we came back. Needless to say, when we came back (around 12 or so) the front deks area was closed and locked, no body around and of course no TV remote anywhere in sight. They have a "continental breakfast" from 7:30 Am to 10 Am., I don't know where the people that had said in their reviews that the breakfast was ok are from or where they have stayed, but this was NOT a continental breakfast at all. Coffe was ok, hard boiled eggs and some package cheeses, some boxed croissants and breads. The only saving grace that you can actually go to the beach area and sit outside and relax and enjoy the view. Overall, bad. With so many choices of quality hotels in the Keys and Key West, you are better off paying a little more and have a nice stay somewhere else. Never staying there again.!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angieloveland70
Reviews.Content: What a great place.. friendly staff, clean and affordable rates..

Reviews.Title: “So long as you know what you're getting into....”
Reviews.Author: bluesman111
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I decided to take several days off to get away and do some fishing and relaxing in Key West after a brutal New England winter. We found a package deal that was priced right, saw the mixed reviews on this property, and decided to keep our expectations low and take the plunge. Our expectations were about low enough. There is a pool, there is a sandy beach for relaxing, but there is no swimming in the bay--it's very shallow and weedy. There is a "marina", which is a narrow channel (in which apparently manatees actually do appear). But you have to also be prepared for a rather poorly managed motel where you have to stay on top of the front desk manager to get basic things like the proper number of hand and face towels, replacement packages for your in-room coffee machine, etc. The front desk clerks seem to do their best to keep guests happy, but the service staff can be seen moving at a snails pace to do the minimum necessary. The fault seems to lie with "Steve," the owner (?) or general manager(?) So, so long as you willing to accept a place that gives meaning to a two star rating (the rooms a pleasant enough and the location is fairly convenient by cab to the action), AND you can get a package deal that gets you the room at less than the $175/night they charge, go for it. Otherwise, look elsewhere and be prepared to spend more for your accommodations. Incidentally, the clientele was a rather eclectic mix of German and British tourists, 30-something couples, and very overweight middle aged guys who obviously see nothing wrong parading around the grounds shirtless when, while it is probably not illegal, with their bodies, it should be. P.S. No children under 16 allowed, but pets are.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cozy, affordable”
Reviews.Author: tcsace
Reviews.Content: This dated hotel provided friendly service, beautiful pool and waterfront beach. If new and flashy are what you seek, look elsewhere. If you seek affordable, comfortable accomodations, this may be the place for you. Don't be put off by the adult - clothing optional status unless you are easily offended by this, as it is more of a rarity than a common occurence. Continental breakfast was adequate, juice/coffee/cereal/bagels/etc. Tiki bar uses wine based liquor and charges resort prices. Drink your own or go out. Overall, would reccomend and will stay there again on future visits, barring better oppoutunities downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great potential”
Reviews.Author: J_B_BEAR
Reviews.Content: The goods: *Great location - away from Duval street so you can relax if you want *Free parking *Public area is beautiful (private beach, swimming pool, breakfast/lounging patio) *Clean sheets *Large room *Cheaper than other Key West hotels (and you can pay for it using AA miles) *Complimentary breakfast The bads: *smell like a cheap motel *outdated decor *Cheap (quality) complimentary shampoo/lotion/soap (Luckily I didn't need to use theirs since I had extras from another hotel I stayed at the night before) The quirks: *clothing optional

Reviews.Title: “Not what it shows online”
Reviews.Author: frnccbr
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Banana Bay Resort in Key West wit my spouse, sister & brother-in-law. This hotel is nothing like what it looks like online. They did have a decent continental breakfast but that is just about the only thing. The resort is tired & needs some TLC & updating. We stayed from a Friday to Monday & not one day was the Tiki Bar open. The room had a musty smell. The beds were uncomfortable. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to the Keys”
Reviews.Author: alanmichaels
Reviews.Content: Good price for the money and close to Duval St. After A long day of walking ( yes we could have taken the site seeing way but chose walking ) and seeing the sites the 4 poster bed was a great comfort after a great hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Resort - not at all!”
Reviews.Author: PypsandFriends
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this "resort" for 2 nights because they advertised that pets are welcome, kids are not (we have a German shepherd). As others already noted, the place is REALLY dated, with wall paper peeling off in the bathroom, WIFI only in a common room, etc. We could totally live with all this, however, the place is not well sound-prooved. There were some young party punks staying above us, having loud exchanges & arguments from 3AM till down. The second night, bunch of other guests decided to have fun at the pool around 2AM, screaming, running up & down the boardwalk, and up and down the hallways. Needless to say, good-night sleep was a dream. The office for the "resort" closes at 10PM, and apparently there is security on premises, but I guess they didn't find excessive noise in the middle of the night a problem. Also, the phone in our room didn't work, so we couldn't even attempt to contact security. Overall, for the price (over $130/night), I'd probably look up some other choices...

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: KingsKid351
Reviews.Content: Clean, but old and not well maintained. Wallpaper peeling off in the bathroom and service sketchy. At one point we were told they ran out of soap for the bath. Bed was comfortable and good parking area for the car. Pool isn't heated and was ice cold. Nice workout room. Internet only available in the common lounge area and very slow. No beach but there are very few in Key West hotels. Mangroves are protected so many places (like this one) have a sandy area up to the sea-wall, not a beach. Okay here if you're just looking for a place to sleep and sit in the sun. Adult means there may be topless women at the pool. Need transport to get to the heart of activities. Recommend if you understand the limitations.

Reviews.Title: “What A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: FunTravlerUSA
Reviews.Content: The cleaning staff failed to clean our rooms. The place advertises that it is adutl only, well I guess they did not tell the families with the children. On top of that, the place advertises that they have a "Tiki Bar." They may have a "Tiki Bar" but it has not been open for the last week that we have been here. We'll find someother place next time. I recommend that you not waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a resort. Spend a little more for a nicer place!”
Reviews.Author: Get0utandseethew0rld
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days there. This is not a resort, it's more like a run down Motel 6. Upon opening the door to the room, we were greeted by an overwelming musty smell. It took an hour of leaving the windows and door open to air it out. The decor is 70's and in need of attention. Bathroom had cracks in the paint, stains in the shower floor and was missing the TP holder. The king size bed had a queen size mattress pad. (very uncomfortable) The advertised "heated" pool was not heated. The "Hot" tub, was luke warm. The Marina was a block away. If you are going to go all the way to Key West for a vacation, spend a little more and stay at a REAL resort!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best spots on the Island!!!”
Reviews.Author: novely81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quiet getaway and we got exactly what we wanted and more. We stayed in room 214 and had a beautiful veiw of the pool. The pool is really pretty!!! If you don't want to deal with the crowds of people everyday while watching the sunsets you can relax on their comfy cushioned chairs right on the water and take in the breathtaking veiw.Let me remind you that this hotel is not the Hilton nor does it claim to be.The rooms are a little dated but the king size bed was really comfortable. Both my husband and I had a hard time getting out of in the morning. (ha ha ha). if you want to take in the true culture of the Keys this is the place to be. Also, let me tell you about the awesome customer service we received from the front desk girls!! My husband I forgot our keys in the Keys,not only did they go in the room and search for us they FedEx'd them too us overnight. If that's not going out of their way then I don't know what is!! Both girls were very friendly, accomidating and truly genuine. Don't miss this hotel, after a lon day on Duval St it is the best place to truly get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: boscobylaw
Reviews.Content: Don't know how you can give bad reviews to this hotel. Out of the way, quiet, comfortable! Went to Fantasy Fest and was glad to return here at night. Adult hotel allowed us to swim without worrying about kids--and we swam naked! Hope the FF crowd does not find out about this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dirty rooms and very poor staff attitude - DO NOT GO HERE”
Reviews.Author: nicolahickinbotham
Reviews.Content: on arrival we were met by a dirty room, rubbish left in the cupboards and filthy room, this is not what we expected in this beautiful location. went to reception to see if we could upgarde to a sea view, NOWAY for you was our response, apprently they checked the room the next day for extra cleaning and there was no change, we lived with someone elses empty mcdonlads box all week. No replacement coffee, no clean towles, room stank, no way of getting any ventilation yuk. Supposed to be fresh fruit, crossiants etc for breakfast, turned out breakfast! in a room off reception that had random chairs, half jug of coffee, stale bread, crumbs and jam on table, NO WAY were we staying in there. Staff attitude is appaling how they are in the customer service industry I dont know. Only saving grace was the sun set view from the beach! which would squeeze about four people on but if you got there first you had it to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: HaroldPHD
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel during week day and was not expecting much during a quick stay in Key West but it was really poor. The grounds of the property were in bad shape with no signs of any staff or any manager on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week Labor Day weekend”
Reviews.Author: GeekMaster
Reviews.Content: Excellent and Fabulous. Banana Bay is PET FRIENDLY (we booked on bringfido.com) and it exceeded expectations (based on other tourist towns like Daytona and Miami). It was clean and well accomodating. The room was quaint with netting on beds. The beach was only so-so because of rock protections - you can get in water, but with difficulty. the resort faces the gulf and a couple nearby tiny keys. the water is crystal clear with abundant seagrass, fish and crabs visible, seabirds are plenty (no annoying seagulls). there are even a few rabbits that seem to be semi-domestic. The staff keeps the place tidy. The pools was hot (as expected in September). the only negative was the hot tub was not so much at times (hot tub gets some shade). The pool area is clothing optional and everyone was well mannered. the pool was visited by the 25-65 age; apparently the resort doesnt allow under 16. the clothing (less) and kid-less are big benefits. there is several large shopping across the street. the tour trams stop across street at Fairfield. no bugs - which extremely surprsing for mid-summer. the tiki bar was closed. however, I spent more on Duval per night than I did for the room (maybe I should not admit that). Nothing to complain about. We have had much less satisfying stays in Daytona and Miami ("better" more costly hotels). We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: PanhandleBob
Reviews.Content: Some people are just never happy. Having said that, the term "resort" has changed somewhat over time. Back in the day, if your Florida motel had some acreage, a pool and some palm trees it was called a "resort." Now of course the word has a different meaning. The Banana Bay is certainly not on a par with a 5-star luxury hotel with all the amenities, but it is a fine place to stay if you're not Mick Jagger, and you don't want to spend a fortune on a place where you're basically just going to sleep. My buddy and I took a trip on our motorcycles to Key West. We *could* have stayed at the Casa Marina, but didn't want that. We arrived on a weekday. The Banana Bay is out-of-the-way, and separate from all the other typical chain hotel/motels you find when you first get into KW. The staff was friendly, the place was clean - it got us wondering if the people who wrote bad reviews even stayed at the same place? Yes, yes, the carpeting in the rooms should be replaced with tile. Other than that, the room was fine, and had the usual microwave/refrigerator/iron/hair dryer that we've come to expect. We liked the ceiling fan - nice touch! It's the tropics, after all. And we liked the little balcony with table and chairs. The pool area was nice and clean and well-maintained. All in all, a very nice hotel! By the way, the Banana Bay had the most comfortable bed/pillows of any hotel I've stayed at recently, which has been mainly Holiday Inn Expresses and the like. As for the breakfast... As hotels get more competitive, they offer bigger and bigger breakfast bars, to include eggs and waffles and stuff. It gets silly. You want a big breakfast? There's a Waffle House right up the street. The Banana Bay advertises and provides a continental breakfast of cereals, bagels, and muffins, with plenty of coffee and juice. What part of "continental breakfast" do people not understand? It was fine for us. Oh, there was no fresh fruit, boo-hoo. Like I said, some people are never happy. You could eat your breakfast outside under the palm trees on a little patio by the water, which we did. Marvelous! Nice way to start off your day. Alternatively there is another patio with tables that overlooks the pool/jacuzzi. We liked the tropical setting of the place. Yes, it was on the water but no, it had no beach. Big deal. Being right on the water is a BIG plus in my book. Few hotels in KW are actually *on* the water. There is no wireless internet in the room, although the breakfast room is a wireless hotspot and has a desktop computer for guests to use. No problem for me, as I left *my* computer home (we were supposed to be on vacation!). My riding buddy brought his, and got online in the room through his cellphone, which worked fine. Whatever problems this hotel may have had in the past, they seem to be corrected as of August of 2010. We had a great time staying there, and when I go back to Key West, I'm going to stay there again. Can you do better in Key West than stay at the Banana Bay? Not for the money you can't. But you can do a LOT worse. (By the way, I'm not an employee or shill - contact me at BH206bB3@juno.com if you want to know more.)

Reviews.Title: “Pros/Cons”
Reviews.Author: natalieees
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Banana Bay because of the price difference and location between other establishments on the island. THE PROS: --My first impression of BB (Banana Bay) was decent. One of the associates, Matt, held our baggage when we arrived early from the airport. He recommended several restaurants, activities, beaches and bars to go to... and they all turned out GREAT! I really enjoyed several of his choices. He also gave my sister and I coupons for them... which was a plus since everything on the island is so expensive. --The pool was always clean and a very nice temperature. I even sat in the hot tub once and it was very very enjoyable--even on a hot day. --The private "beach" was quaint and nice... you can lay out in serious silence --The pool seemed to be never busy... it was quiet and there weren't a bunch of kids screaming and jumping in the pool. The pool was very relaxing. --Military Discount (if you apply...) THE NEGATIVES: --When I called & made a reservation (at the actual hotel) I clarified that the tiki bar was open and actively being used... the woman who helped me said it WAS open.... to my surprise upon check-in, it was not. I was really disappointed. --Almost every time we went to the pool, we had to ask/call for pool towels... and most of the time they were out. This was frustrating since we had to use our bath towels. For some reason they seemed stingy on towels... --The heat/AC in our room was inconsistent. It was either blazing or an igloo in our room. It was so frustrating. We had to get up in the middle of the night to either turn on/off the AC... seriously ridiculous. --The Housekeeping cleaned at very weird hours.... we had to call to see if they were coming to our room, and to our surprise--they forgot. They came around 6pm after we called... it was odd. If you need any other info, let me know. I'd be happy to help...

Reviews.Title: “outdoor stress reliever but indoor stress achiever”
Reviews.Author: threec
Reviews.Content: Fantastic well manacured grounds with beautiful bay views that let your brain wind down to a stop. Staff that was terrific with all our needs and a cleaning team to be commended, our room was spotless and smelled great. Was very impressed by Steve , the GM, who was physically working his butt off, very unusual for management. That was the pro this is the con. The room was in great need of a complete overhaul of very basic problems. When these issues are taken care of this, property will reach its potential. Incidentally its pet friendly and our golden retriever, "Clancee" loved his vacation. CC & CC

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: desh47
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a relaxing week in Fort Myers. Decided to take the Key West Express to Key west for a night. I thought I did my home work while looking for a place to stay there for one night. Pulled up in front of the place after an $11.00 cab ride and was shocked. There should be a law against false advertising! "Resort" it certainly is NOT. Their website is totally misleading. The place is a dump. They claim to be beachfront, well they are not. They claim to be close to Duval street, well they are not. Another $11.00 cab fare. Front desk people rude as hell! The guest checking in in front of us got the exact same room for $89.00 and we paid $163.00! When I asked the front desk how that could be, they blamed it on Travelocity! I never even booked through them! Then they refused to show me the paper work! Very shady business practices! We had to stay because we had no choice a refund was out of the question! Again, dirty room. I cant believe this place hasn't been shut down! My lawyer is looking into their secret way of charging their guests. Maybe I can at least get my money back. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive town!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanJunkee!
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a quick get-away and the Keys seemed very appealing until I began looking at hotel prices! We found Banana Bay Resort on a website, and I quickly read the reviews here. With a bit of trepidation, we booked, and I'm SO GLAD we did!!! The ADULT ONLY hotel property is not fancy, but maintained quite well for it's age. The pool/beach area were beautiful. Again, not a 5* resort, but definitely not the "dump" that some other reviewers would have you believe. First the outside: the pool area is very nice with plenty of towels, shaded areas, tables, and cushioned lounge chairs. The sandy beach area looks out onto a pretty bay and the crystal clear water. Like most resorts in KW, this is not a swimming beach, so don't expect that. The "pile of sand" that people speak of as being "Gross" was leftover sand they use to keep up the beach area. It looks as though there was an old pool they've filled in on another part of the property, and dumped the excess sand in that area. No, it's not pretty, but No, its not visible from your room/balcony either. We were able to sit on our balcony each day/night and not be bothered by mosquitoes, which was an unexpected surprise. Rooms: We stayed in room 116 which had a view of both the beach area and the pool. I think the primary flaw with this hotel is that the rooms are carpeted, which is never a good idea in a tropical area. There was a bit of a musty smell which one would expect in a humid climate where carpet is concerned, but it was not a deal breaker for us. The rooms are a very nice size for the price, and come with a good sized refrigerator, a sink, some cabinets, and a microwave. All of which come in very handy should you care to buy food to make your own lunches during the day (or even dinner to save a few bucks). There are no utensils, so be sure to grab some plasticware along the way. The King sized bed was VERY comfortable with great pillows. For the budget minded traveler, this is a great water front hotel not far from the action of Duvall street, without the lofty price. If you're looking for the Ritz, the Westin, or even the Sheraton, this isn't it, but neither is the price tag!!! Also, be advised that topless sunbathing is welcomed here. Just a tip, if you've never been to the Keys, I suggest you travel by car from Miami instead of simply flying directly to Key West. It's a beautiful drive and only takes about 3 hours total. We rented a car for less than the cost of a daily bike rental or taxi ride in KW!!! EZ rental car out of Miami airport (you have to call them for a shuttle driver) has rates of $13 PER DAY!!!! it's an easy scenic filled drive, and you can always stop off at the other keys for a quick swim along the way :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here if You Want to get Robbed”
Reviews.Author: hurrikate
Reviews.Content: We were turned off by the unkempt condition of the pool and beach area, however, we decided to brush this aside. When we got to our hotel room, the bedroom area was fine, however the bathroom was disgusting. There were splattered red markings on the bathroom door. It was really gross. We werenâ€™t expecting The Hilton, but this is something a fresh coat of paint could have easily taken care of. However, our experience during the overnight hours is even more disconcerting. We went to sleep at around midnight. At around 2am, my husband awoke to hear someone on our balcony trying to get in to our room. He screamed for him to leave, and the suspect left, apologizing that he had the â€œwrong room.â€� We then proceeded to call the front desk/security three times (for about 20 minutes) with no answer. That was absolutely ridiculous. Needless to say, it was a sleepless night for us. We were on the first floor, which as you know, is elevated. My husband, who is 6â€™8â€� and physically fit, was able to climb on to the balcony of our room, however he said it was quite difficult. This makes me suspect that the person who entered our room may have had practice and it was an attempted robbery. When we checked out Sunday morning, we reported the incident to the front desk staff. They were apologetic and informed us the front desk closed at 10pm, but security should have handled the call. We informed them that we attempted to contact security three times to no avail, at which point they replied that they would make sure they would tell them. I question whether they have security at all. Regardless, do not stay here - you can find something better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “TERMITES!! Stay at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: Danny5995
Reviews.Content: Good: The staff was friendly and free parking...that's all. Bad: We booked 2 nights at this resort via Orbitz. We checked in around 7pm and the first thing we noticed is this resort needs remodeling. As the previous reviewers had mentioned, the furniture was purchased from a garage sale. Water in the bathroom sink was clogging up. The room had a really foul odor that did not go away. We headed downtown for dinner. Around 10pm we returned to our room and we were shocked at what we saw. There were 100s of these flies/worms-like creatures crawling all over the counter, lamp shades, on our bed and inside our luggage! We immediately called the front desk, but no one answered. Turns out their hours are 7am-10pm. There was an emergency number on the front desk door and we called it...it was their on-site security. Security didn't have the owner's/manager's number to call. The security officer confirmed the creatures as TERMITES. We killed them all and 30 minutes later, they all came back! After looking around the room we found that they were all living behind the large mirror above the counter. Barf! To make a long story short, we left the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, fun and away from the Duval St hustle!”
Reviews.Author: utisme
Reviews.Content: Our trip was just prior to Memorial Day and we were really pleased with all aspects. Staff was friendly, room spacious and clean, pool well kept, tiki bar fun and bay area views/relaxation great. We were a bit cautious upon check in due to some reviews, but we either had the exception to most or the resort made changes. I tend to lean to the resort improvements and will definitely return to Banana Bay next trip to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Run down Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: simon4445
Reviews.Content: I checked out the hotel online and when we arrived WOW!!!! They really have a good web master. Upon arrival after a 3 hour drive from Miami and flight from Kansas we pulled up to a non resort. I confirmed with a phone call that we would have 2 beds. When I walked in to check in I told the girl working that this is NOT what was on their web page. She asked if we wanted to see the room I said ok. Went to our room and only 1 bed. And it was not a very nice room. Went down to tell her we were suppose to have 2 beds and that I wanted out of my reservation and was told I would have to pay for that night. I said umm NO let me speak to a manager, she says "hes not on site" . Told her she needs to find him within seconds he magically appeared. I told them they false advertised and the girl that was at the desk had some mumbles of words to say. They were going to make me pay for the night. I told them either let me out of it or we can go trhu my lawyer. Then they let me out but I was told they didnt have anything to print up for my records saying I wouldnt be charged. I had to make the manager hand write something for me. I would NOT want anyone to stay here. False advertisement on a run down hotel hell.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but I wouldn't consider it a resort”
Reviews.Author: Parrothead1975
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect when we were driving to the 'resort', but when we pulled up, I was a bit scared. The building looks more like a motel, than a resort, but we only needed a place to stay for one night. Check in was simple and our room was very large. We went out to the balcony which overlooked the pool and to our surprise, women were topless. We proceeded down to the tiki bar (located next to the pool )and enjoyed the view of the makeshift beach. The breeze was quite nice and the bartender was extremely helpful. He recommended a scooter rental person who gave us a fabulous rate for four days. The breakfast wasn't great, but what can you expect for a continental breakfast? The hotel is located about 1.6 miles from Duval and a taxi was around $15, so walk (in your sneakers) if you can. It was not resort quality, but if you need a quite place to stay, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A+ all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: LannieAnnie64
Reviews.Content: Loved our room, pool, breakfast, Scott and Perry! For the price you are getting a really great place to stay. Enjoyed our stay and can't wait to go back again. "Michigan Girls".

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but several concerns and suggestions”
Reviews.Author: merrybrook1
Reviews.Content: . . . beware of an idealized website and listing. Many items offered are not available -- no morning paper, for instance. Also, while rooms and bath are clean and quiet, the sliders out to balcony -- just off the parking area -- are not easy to secure. The three pillows on each of the two double beds are wonderful, but one of the headboards was completely askew upon arrival. The "draperies" for the sliders barely reach, but still stand away from the doors so that morning light greets you very early, no matter how you try to arrange them. If you want to bathe instead of shower or want to fill the sink for shaving/face-washing-rinsing, bring along your own stoppers -- neither have them. Hot/cold in sink is reversed! The resort does not have a swimming beach, contrary to claims. The breakfast is nominal, and while there are minimal coffee services in each room, breakfast (and better coffee) isn't available before 7:30 a.m. The Tiki Bar and pool (clothing optional), although located in a "strictly adult" property, close at a very early hour, with no alternatives nearby. Can't comment on towel service, since neither of us wanted to swim in the pool -- we were expecting a salt-water experience. CONCERN: When I noticed that this property "may charge a resort fee at checkout," I called directly and asked what specifically my TOTAL bill would be upon checkout -- the amount I was told was indeed the amount on the final bill. I have just learned that my credit card account has just temporarily authorized a considerably higher amount. I'm waiting for the manager of the property (who is "out and about, but there") to return my call, and will update review accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ynonino
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet, secluded, place only about a mile and a half from Duval, then stay here. Rooms are nice, pool is great, great little private beach, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Scott and Perry, the 2 bar tenders at the Tiki Bar by the pool are really cool and extremely friendly. Definitely would stay here again. Came down for a week and hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good place to stay in price range”
Reviews.Author: NCSWerMom
Reviews.Content: We found Banana Bay resort to be a good choice in the price range. Our room was comfortable and spacious. The grounds and waterfront areas are lovely. Good continental breakfast. You can stay in higher priced hotels and find more amenities and updates, but for the price, our stay there was just fine. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “This could be a great hotel with some TLC”
Reviews.Author: lindholli
Reviews.Content: The breakfast room looked like it had been furnished from a yard sale. The chairs were too deep to sit in and the tables too high to eat at, nothing matched. The toasters needed trashing, as neither worked properly. The pool area is the best part of the hotel. The pool bar had a limited drink selection, beer or vodka but was cheap. The room needed painting and some serious grout cleaning. There was no stopper for the drain and the canopy for the bed was missing. The outer bedding had red stains on it. This could be such a great place, looks like it used to be a motel and it has not really shed that image.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity defined”
Reviews.Author: kcscoutmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Keys, and we were struck by the number of dumpy, 50 year-old roadside motels that slapped the word "resort" on their signs. While Banana Bay is not among that group (yet), one gets the idea they are just on the cusp. Everywhere we looked, there were signs that the place was in disrepair: peeling paint and bad patch jobs on the walls; wallpaper being held in place with clear packaging tape; lamps burned out; a poorly installed ceiling fan that wobbled so badly it could only be run on low-speed; broken plastic rocking chairs on the balcony; the balcony was missing roughly half of its flooring tiles; the window was in such bad shape that if you tried to open it, it the whole lower half of the window fell out of the wall. The first night there, we were awakened by yelling from a party taking place in the pool area. When we tried calling the office, we reached a recording saying the office closed at 10:30 p.m. As another reviewer has noted, while there is free wireless internet access, it is only available in one "community" room. Don't count on printing your airline boarding passes there, though, as the printer was out of toner.

Reviews.Title: “relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: wowfort
Reviews.Content: I guess I can't say enough good things about this hotel...We arrived about 3 in the afternoon and check-in was flawless. Got to our room which was clean and spacious although the bathroom needed updating and we went out on the balcony which overlooked the pool and just sat for a minute then went around the grounds which were very nicely landscaped and sat for a few with our feet hanging over the edge of the dock area. If you are looking for a quiet relaxing place with clean comfortable rooms then this is the place for you. It is 1.6 miles to duval st but that was a good thing for us because it was quiet...sitting on the balcony by the pool, and still going down to duval and other areas of the island was easy and convenient although parking on the island is very expensive (between 2 and 4 dollars an hour depending on location). All in all fantastic place to spend a week! As a sidebar if you are looking far a nice beach go to Smathers on the east side of the island it was clean and very pretty . Not much in the way of facilities although non of the lsland beaches are good that way. good luck on your search and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “A dive not worth the money, where guest are second to employee's”
Reviews.Author: departing
Reviews.Content: Sticky carpets Lots of mold Decking is way past the replacement point, lots of opportunities to hurt ones self No onsite staff after midnight, try getting in your room if youâ€™re locked out Had to wait for the employees to get breakfast before me at the disgusting continental breakfast bar

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 2 1/2 Star”
Reviews.Author: chasity4780
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Banana Bay to celebrate our one year anniversary. We weren't expecting much so I wasn't too disappointed. I was more disappointed with Key West in general. It's rowdy and the beaches are bad. However, I'm glad I went so I can check it off my list. If I had to go back to Key West I would consider staying again but I don't plan on going back. Positives: Close to airport, Free Parking, Pets Allowed, Away from Duval Street noise, $8 cab ride to Duval, Gym, Continental Breakfast, Cute Property Bunnies, Bay View which is better than no view. Negatives: Needs Maintenance. This isn't really a resort. No restaurant and I'm guessing they don't run the Tiki bar, or clean the pool, if it's below 70 degrees out.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumKrisNBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banana Bay Key West in March of 2008 when we got engaged and then recommended it to our friends and family to stay for our wedding in Key West in March of 2010. We stayed again as well because it had been such a great bargain previously. This time however the rooms were not nearly as nice as I remember, there was a lot of maintenance needed. All the rooms (our group booked 4) had wallpaper hanging from the walls in the bathrooms and were in need of new tile and carpet. The walls and celings were quite dirty and there was mold growing on the photo in our room. There were quite a few improvements needed to the outside and inside in order for me to recommend it again. It appeared more of a discount motel than a resort as it is sold to be. The front desk staff was very rude and not helpful in the afternoon shift and the breakfast was not nearly as fresh as we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting beyond belief.”
Reviews.Author: NycAnna
Reviews.Content: So gross. Looks like it hasn't been cleaned in years. Where do I start: hair all over bathroom, soap scum & water marks all over sink and tub, caked-on [--] on the inside AND outside of toilet, a towel that was completely soaking wet (upon my arrival)--who knows if it has been changed since the previous guest. So, so much more, but I don't want to spoil your sleep. I tried to switch to two other rooms, but they were even worse! One had a clump of hair hanging on the bath faucet, a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ojenni513
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with this hotel. A couple of things..The room was large the bed was nice and the pillows were very comfy. BUT the wallpaper in the bathroom was hanging off the walls, and not just in a small spot , ALL OF IT. There were people working in the gardens every day BUT the pool was filthy leaves and a newspaper on the bottom was still there when we left. I understand that the weather was not great a little chilly and no one was probably going to swim but still one of those gardeners could have cleaned the pool. The Tikki bar was never opened. It was posted closed on Monday and Tuesday but was still closed on Wed and Thurs. Again the weather I am sure had something to do with it. But when you are coming from 2 feet of snow and below freezing temps, 65 and sunny is paradise. I would have loved a drink on several occasions but had to find it elsewhere. The staff was friendly. We rented bikes one day and they arranged for them to be brought to us. But I am not sure that is not more of the rental places doing and not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In need of maintenance”
Reviews.Author: expatalicante
Reviews.Content: A fairly expensive hotel located overlooking the bay, but a long way from the main attractions. It is in desperate need of maintenance. Part of the wall paper in the bathroom was missing and in general the exterior appearance was untidy. The reception staff showed little or no interest and were not particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Look else where.”
Reviews.Author: MontyBuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Jan 31 thru Feb 4, 2010. It was a great disappointment. Everything is very poorly maintained. The beds were a joke. The complimentary breakfast was not even on a par with a motel 6. Hard boiled eggs is not my idea of breakfast. For the price, spend a little more and get a real vacation. The one good thing, the pool was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.. Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: lonniecheryl
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay, we found the staff to be very helpful and very nice. A room was ready on our arrival and we were allowed to go ahead and go to our room and start enjoying our day in Key West. The room was very nice and romantic, it over looked the pool and beach area, I found the grounds to be very well kept. The breakfast was good and the staff was wonderful. It is quiet at he banana bay and very enjoyable. We enjoyed our stay at banana bay and we have already made plans to return and we are planning on staying here again. Thank you to the staff for making our stay a great one, cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can deceive, really nice place”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugLeana
Reviews.Content: When we first pulled up, i thought my husband was going to kill me. I had read the reviews and knew the hotel was not going to look like much pulling up - it was bad, but the hotel is really nice. My first thought at seeing the front is some horror movie where the teenagers stop and get killed. It's NOTHING like that - it's very nice. The staff is super friendly - Very friendly, at first you might not think so as they are getting you checked in but soon as you get to talk to them, they are nice. Check out was super easy and again, friendly staff. Our room was larger than I had expected and clean - which is a big thing to me. The bed was really nice and the windows so clean on the balcony it could have been easy to miss them and walk right into them. The hotel is adult only which I think is WONDERFUL. You must be 16 and over to stay here. The pool is topless only although it used to be fully clothing optional so some guest who have been coming for years still go in their b-day suits. If this bothers you, this is not the place for you. We didn't have a long stay here, but we would no doubt stay again. The bathroom products are bath and body works. The wall paper in our bathroom could use a replacement as it's coming off the walls behind the door, but that's hard to avoid with hot showers being taken constantly Our Room had a view of the pool and some of the "beach" . Keep in mind Key West is not known for it's beaches and besides the man-made ones, there really aren't any to visit. If you are looking to spend time at the beach, you need to look at another location, Key West isn't it. The hotel is a short drive to downtown where parking is a pain in the butt. We chose to drive and park, but many people take a taxi down (was told it's $10 each way). Downtown parking 25 cents per 10 minutes - it can get costly so try to find free parking or a parking lot that charges a flat rate if you are going to be there a while. There is no shuttle offered by the hotel. Overall, I was impressed, the outside of the hotel is very deceiving, but the rooms are very lovely. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great value”
Reviews.Author: elizmax
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit off the beaten path, so a car is a must. The rooms are clean and spacious and overlook the pool. The service was fine, and the complimentary breakfast was very good. However, the room decor is a bit outdated and worn, and the location is away from the action in Key West (but we liked the quiet).

Reviews.Title: “The staff is AWESOME!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiComet
Reviews.Content: The reason I decided on this hotel is when I called for info Melanie from the front desk was great! When I called back to book the room I told her she was the reason i chose this resort! The next day when i checked in Elisa was just as helpful!! The hotel was great and you will not find a better team anywhere!!! I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully located hotel that I would definitely recommend and/or come back to again!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulmess219
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several bad hotels in a row and this one has been a wonderful surprise. The room is clean, tidy, pretty, and the bed is oh-so-comfortable! I would definitely come back. There is plenty to do right here in the resort area, including a beautiful view from a mini-beach area with wi-fi :)

Reviews.Title: “Checked out in less than 12 hours...”
Reviews.Author: serendipity423
Reviews.Content: We looked at the reviews for Banana Bay and thought they were reasonable, the website and pictures looked pretty good, and it promised a private beach, etc. When we arrived at 10p, which it is directly on Route 1 across from the scenic views of the Taco Bell and Pawn Shop, the front desk was just closing. We were given a map to our room with no bellhop to help with luggage. We then had to drag our luggage across a flooded parking lot only to enter our room that wreaked of mold, mildew, had a broken fan, lights, and to top it all off, had hairs of the unseemly kind all over the shower. And the private beach? Smaller than a sandbox. We decided to check out first thing in the morning and ask for a refund- when we complained to the front desk they were more than nonchalant to tell us to call Expedia and get a refund- almost like this happens often. While I will give them credit for giving us a refund, I would think any establishment shouldnâ€™t be in the routine about making refunds a habit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, pleasant, and peaceful place!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from August 3-6. We wanted to be close to Duval but not so close that we'd be kept up all night---and this resort provided just that! This was a peaceful place to stay...the rooms were not "loud" (no thin walls!) and the guests were quiet as well. The staff was excellent, the room was very clean, the pool was refreshing, and we enjoyed sitting out on the beach late at night. I was pleasantly surprised to find two very tame rabbits running around on the property. I miss my rabbits so much when I'm away and I was just overjoyed to find these cuties at the resort! I'd also like to note that this is also a safe place to stay. No "shady" guests and the security keeps on top of things late at night. I was questioned while walking around the parking lot (at 1 a.m.) by one security guard, and this reassured me that they take care of their guests and the resort. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised--great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rayback
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean--very nicely decorated. The "adult-only" atmosphere was nice--no kids running around at the pool!! Everything was very nice--nothing to complain about at all It's not far at all to Duval St, and we were able to find parking easily downtown. But you're far enough that it's not too rowdy at night. The beach area at the hotel really wasn't much to speak of--and personally I would not get in to snorkel there. Overall--it was a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem at an amazing price!”
Reviews.Author: Justice1900
Reviews.Content: We initially booked our stay here simply because of the great deal they were offering for July and we were staying for a full week so the price of lodging meant a lot. We were pleasantly surprised with just about everything at this resort! Regarding a previous post - I would still consider this a resort as there is plenty to do right on the property, just no restaurant.
