Rooms were clean (linens and carpet could use an update though) very nicely furnished, LOVED the blinds and the beach area was a beautiful spot to have coffee in the mornings or just relax. The pool was not over crowded, and save for a few immature people commenting on some topless sunbathers the crowd that was there was great. It says a lot that locals enjoy coming here too. We really did not have anything bad to say and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Dalmar31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a weekend in Key West and were looking for a place where we could bring our dogs. Banana Bay seemed to fit the bill. After reading some of the reviews here we were pretty nervous about it. As it turns out, none of these concerns were valid. The room was great, the grounds were beautiful, and the overall value was excellent. Highlights: * There is a 24-hour fitness gym with weight machines and step masters. * The outdoor pool is very nice. There are some topless sunbathers, but that is not unusual at all for South Florida. The Jacuzzi is warm and holds around 6 people. There is a Tiki Bar open at certain hours for drinks. * The "beach" area is very nice. There are no real beaches per se in the Keys, so this man made beach area is really a treat. There is a gazebo, hammocks, deck chairs for sunning, bar-b-que grille, and even a large outdoor chess set. The sunsets here are almost as nice as you see on Mallory Square. * The free Continental Breakfast was great. Hot coffee, orange juice, boiled eggs, a variety of cold cereals, milk, bagels, breads, and mini muffins were available. The breakfast room was nicely appointed with tables and couches. There is also a free Internet accessible computer in this room to check your e-mail or web surf. * We had a room overlooking the pool. The room was nice and had a balcony where we had our breakfast in the morning. The room is 3 star quality. The carpets are indoor - outdoor, as you would expect for an area where most of the time you're going to be wearing a bathing suit and have sandy feet. The furnishings are rattan and tropical. The bed was comfortable, King size, and had plenty of soft pillows. There was a work desk, big comfortable chair, and a TV. Also great was a mini refrigerator where we kept cold drinks and a supply of local freshly made conch salad. If you know anything about the Florida Keys, you know that there are NO bargains. A simple 2/2 condo costs over $1 million here. If you want a 5 Star hotel in Key West with marble baths, concierge, valet parking, and big restaurants...then Banana Bay isn't for you. Banana Bay is a 3 star hotel, with some really great 5 Star amenities. And don't forget it is Pet Friendly. Dale and Martha

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Web Site”
Reviews.Author: ericknj
Reviews.Content: After searching for Hotels in Key West, I came upon Banana Bay resort. I picked this hotel because it was a little cheaper and it looked nice on their web site. I'm here to tell you that It doesn't look much like the pictures on their web site. When we first located the sign for the entrance, it was the wrong entrance and it took us to the "back" of the hotel. Well, the "back" of the hotel looks like it was abandoned. Piles of dirt, dumpsters and parked trucks litter the landscape. My wife and I looked at each other and couldn't believe that this could be the correct place. We exited out of the lot and about 50 feet further was the "main" entrance. The front of the hotel looks better with plenty of tropical plants. Unfortunately, most of the doors to the rooms face the nasty looking part of the hotel. Speaking of the doors, holes are patched in all their doors and they have no electronic access. Obviously, this hotel is not the class we expected. We decided to travel around Key West looking at other hotels and discovered they were all much much nicer. But we were stuck at Banana Bay since they would not give us a refund even though their sign said vacancy. The only reason I can see for staying here is if you just need a place to sleep or you like nude swimming. The pool area is clothing optional. The rates are much too high for just a place to sleep so if you like your clothes on I recommend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place away from the crowd”
Reviews.Author: VirginieVirginie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and relaxing place. We booked 4 nights in a deluxe guest room with a clean kitchen (fully equipped), comfy sofa and a tv set.In the next room, comfy bed, large closet. I loved the "Bath and Body works" shower gel, shampoo, body lotions and soap we got every single day! Tiki bar near the swimming pool/jacuzzi. Book today! Virginie Ars-Marini,France

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: grizz9
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here at the recommendation of a friend who stayed here before. It was just fine except that the bar is closed on Monday and Tuesday--the days we were there. But, really, who wants to drink at the hotel when there are so many places in town. It is over a mile from town, so it is quite a hike if you walk, but not impossible. Room was clean and large. Signs as you leave the pool area say that clothes are required "beyond this point" so I assume that the pool is clothing optional if that is what you want. Internet available only in lobby and the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Tropical, WONDERFUL place in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: Krista86
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews and looked at tons of pictures of this hotel, I was a little skeptical, but I fell in love with this place!!! My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend for one night (3/20/09) and were very happy. If you go to their website, you'll notice that there aren't really any pictures of the front or outside of the hotel- that's because it's not that impressive (I didn't expect much). All of the pictures are of the outside of the hotel (marina and pool), or the rooms which were all VERY nice! I mean, that's really all that matters, right? They could do some work on the front/outside of the hotel. When you drive up, you might think it's not gonna be great, but trust me, it is!! If you go there and don't expect to have a 5 star resort, you'll be happy with it. Once you get to the back of the hotel, there is a lot of shrubbery that give it a really tropical feel to it. The pool is super nice and so is the marina. The rooms have a great, tropical feel to them and the beds are really comfortable. Some of the cons: continental breakfast not anything great (typical cereal, muffins and donuts) and the jacuzzi reeked of clorine (but we still spent 20 minutes in it, so it wasn't unbearable). I would definitely go back to this hotel (and I wanted to after leaving)!! Definitely stay here and you won't regret it!! P.S. The bed bugs posts are NOT true! I didn't have any bug bites when I woke up. :)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this very quaint adult resort, we just disembarct from a seven day cruise from Hell aboard MSC Cruises (don't ever go on this cruise) and we stumbled upon this nice place. The room was nice with a balcony overlooking the pool. It was cold when we were in Key West but the hot tub was great. There is a private bay as well. The staff was great too!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: tallcoolone001
Reviews.Content: i was sceptical after reading the reviews, but after staying there i have learned that some people just need something to complain about. this place was great. its not the Hilton but then again your not paying the Hilton price. the service was great, loved the tiki bar, i do wish it stayed open longer than 7pm though. rooms were clean. i requested a room overlooking the pool and they accommodated me. the young lady at the front desk was very helpful and informing of the whole key west area, gave us the do's and don'ts. its an adult atmosphere so you dont have to worry about kids screaming and running around. it is a clothing optional pool area, which is a good thing, did not see any old men running around naked, which was good, only young ladies with nice bodies topless. great location away from the hustle and bustle, but only a $10 dollar taxi ride down to duval st. nice beach area with lawn chairs overlooking the bay. i will definitely stay there next time i am in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Never again !”
Reviews.Author: crazylab
Reviews.Content: We had the "cabana" # 305 for 3 nights ($159 us/night). This is a one bedroom apartment with a kitchenette in the living room. The place is a complete run down (all beat up). Everything is either broken or filthy (or both). The bed with clean sheets was terrible. We are not usually picky. If it is clean and comfy, we'll take it. But this time the only positive points were; we had a (dirty) kitchen and the pool/lounge chairs were near the door. Even the pool was cold and not taken care of. With a tiny whirlpool. There is a sort of sandy beach above sea level (like a deck) but absolutely no swimming in this ocean. The fridge took hours to cool off. The door lock was smashed. The windows were broken, some screens missing. Blinds were not working either. Could not open them. Light fixtures broken. Wall papers stained and ripped. Rugs disgusting. Tons of mini ants did not help either. Rusty dirty tub/sink. It was really an expensive ( US $ versus canadian $ dollars) and frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker4247
Reviews.Content: I thought this place would be ok but it was totally great! Private with a beautiful view of the Gulf of Mexico. It's is actually on the Gulf and has a great beach area. Nice breakfast in the morning with tables on the beach. My room overlooked the pool and was huge. Large bedroom with 2 closets and a TV. A full bath with Bath and Body Works shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap. A living room/kitchen combo was perfect for saving money on food. It was very slightly dated but clean and comfy. We also stayed at the Waldorf Resort in Key West which was gorgeous but this fit out needs better. We will be going back to Banana Bay without a doubt. One piece of advice- Ladies if you are going to the hot tub take a hand towel to sit on. It has stucco seats that hurt your butt if you sit on it too long in a bathing suit. The hotel doesn't look amazing on the main road but trust me it gets better once you are into the resort. Don't let the front scare you. The staff are SO nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: joizeygal
Reviews.Content: We were travelling back to Key West for a special occasion. We researched where we could go to a pet friendly location. Banana Bay seemed to fit our needs. We were pleased with our room and the staff all seemed to be very nice and friendly. We were there at a very cool climate time in January. Mosquitos were not a problem. I developed welts all over my legs which were extremely itchy. I now have scars on my legs from itching. After doing research, I see that these bites were from "bed bug bites." Other than that, the resort would have been fine. I will have these scars on my legs for a long time. I think Banana Bay should address these problems in their rooms, especially in the offseason before it gets worse.

Reviews.Title: “key west gem”
Reviews.Author: indyparrothead2020
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeynoon the 2nd week of January....this is a great place to stay....resort was clean...rooms were nice...staff was extremely helpful...the weather was perfect...resort is not too far from duval street...my wife and I used the walk to duval street as our exercise for the week....would highly recommend this place to our friends(who are not snobs)..we also will plan a return trip to Banana Bay when we go back to Key West(the perfect town)

Reviews.Title: “NiceTtime”
Reviews.Author: travler2009la
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay with you in the Keys and are already planning our trip next year. The pool and hot tub were wonderful especially with the cooler weather we had while there. Also, the staff was very friendly and willing to help with any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! Won't stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: dustidawnmusic
Reviews.Content: We first arrived and I thought the place on the outside was adorable. The rooms were good looking...note our bed had a bug net (for looks of course...but I had to add that due to irony). My husband and I awoke the next morning and we both had little red dots all over my arms and neck that itched ALOT! So, we went and had our free breakfast which was fine. We left for the day to see the sights and returned later that evening. Fell asleep and awoke again to MORE red dots on our arms and neck. We checked out that morning and I informed the lady at the front desk and she was certainly not concerned at all. She informed me that they look like mosquito bites...I informed her that I know what a mosquito bite feels like...we do have those in Indiana. She was very unempathetic and unhelpful. I felt they could have at least tried to make some effort to apologize or offer a discount for next time or that time...but there was nothing. Our friends stayed at a different hotel and they were fine. I am home now three days later and my arms still itch and have huge red bumps on them. Would I recommend?? No...I don't feel paying good money to get bed bug bits is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: modifiedplan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Banana Bay a few months go and had a pleasant trip. I tried to book a return visit for March. As I went on the website I noticed that they had advertised specials $169. a night. However when I called they said that there were "NO Specials" I insisted that I saw it on the website and asked to speak to a manager. When I finally did speak to the manager, he acknowledged that there are specials posted on the internet- however he will not honor it. I was shocked that they could do anything...... is is truly a bait and switch game they are playing. Shame Shame Banana Bay!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: 3fromMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on our honeymoon. The location was a bit far from all the fun stuff, and there really isn't a beach. The room was nice and big, cute decor. Bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom. We had a King Bed that I was less than impressed with. Very uncomfortable. Thankfully we only were staying there one night. Staff was very friendly when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “no longer clothing optional”
Reviews.Author: allovertan12
Reviews.Content: We were under the impression that this was clothing optional around the pool but this has been changed (they allways have to spoil a good thing). We would not return because of this change in policy. Why can't they leave things as they were, as an adult only place with clothing optional we all have a choice but the choice has been removed. Hopefully they will have a change this and make it clothing optional again in certain areas.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Randy_marsh
Reviews.Content: First time to the keys.......where to stay? So, this resort is really easy to find provided you go NORTH on roosevelt road when you leave U.S 1. Banana bay is set in quite spacious grounds with palms and banana plants everywhere. Reception was very helpful on check in and every time we needed help to get a cab they were great. the room was way above what i would expect, four poster , cooking area and very clean. The pool was really good, the grounds well kept and also a gorgeous hot-tub. They have a beach front (no beach, like the rest of the keys!) and it is definitley a great place to relax in the evenings. Theres no food on site but with many a place to eat along the same street , including the awesome tgi's, it didnt really matter at all. Overall this is a calm , clean and peaceful base to enjoy the keys. BUT, They do have a cage with 20 odd white doves in that is just awful to see. I dont know if they have them on site to release for a wedding moment or whether they are just there for people to look at. Its just awful to see such glorious birds caged , just plain sad. Do something about this and the place would become awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not clothing optional”
Reviews.Author: nudistbicpl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were spending 2 weeks in the Key. We came across this hotel by accident. During the search of past reviews we found many that indicated the pool was clothing optional. So when I called, the staff said this was an adult resort and the pool was clothing optional. We were staying at the Crown Plaza the first week of our trip. When we checked out of the first hotel, we called and asked if we could drop our luggage off at Banana Bay before we checked in. They said â€œno problem, come on overâ€�. So we didâ€¦ Keep in mine it was 10:00am when we got to the front desk. The staff were so nice and friendly. They told us our room was ready and we could check in now. Keep in mind it was 10 in the morning, most hotels were still checking people out at that time. So they gave us our key and we went up to our room. What a surprise. Room was very nice, great view overlooking the pool and bay. So we decided to pass on going to the beach and decided to go sit at the pool for the day. We get down to the pool and there is one couple there. She is topless and he is bottomless. No problem for us, being the nudists we are. We take off our suits and enjoy the sun. A short time later a couple comes down and sits next to us. They are telling us that the resort is not really clothing optional anymore. Well we were told that is was when we made the reservations and checked in. We did ask the manager again and he told us that because we had been told this when we checked in we could be nude during our stay. We also came to find out that this couple was not even staying at the resort but lived in the area and just like to use the pool here. After a few more days, we met many other nudists who use Banana Bay to lay out. None of them were guests. Kinds pissed us off, we were paying $184.00 per night and these people were just trespassing. The icing on the cake was when a group of local teens showed up and started drinking. After about 2 hours they did get kicked out, but the nerveâ€¦. Overall the resort is very nice, clean and well kept. Security is a joke. Our guess is that over half of the people that use the facility are not even guests.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: Wing64d
Reviews.Content: The accomidations were nice and the hotel staff was very accomidating during our stay. The dolphin and snorkling trip that the hotel works with was great. That is the upside. The downside was that when we first booked the hotel, we were under the impression that it was a clothing optional / adults only location. We found that that had changed before we arrived. That being said, I'd give it 4 out of 5 stars only because my wife and I practice a clothing optional lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: “Banana Bay was great!”
Reviews.Author: rjjohnson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Banana Bay for 4 nights. We had a nightmarish trip down (we were supposed to get into Miami at 2:30 p.m. and drive down to Key West but ended up not getting to Key West until almost 2 a.m. due to various airplane issues and delays). I called to let them know that we were not going to be there by their 10 p.m. cut-off. They let me know that they would check us in and leave our key with the security guard so we would be able to get into our room without a problem. Although we missed a night in Key West, the remaining nights were fabulous! Banana Bay is a short cab ride to Duval Street (about $10). If you would prefer to stay off the beaten path, Banana Bay is for you; if not, I would recommend staying closer to Duval. It is extremely quiet and has a great pool and tiki bar (there is no restaurant, but you can get delivery from a couple of different places in the area). The room was above average compared to what we saw in the area. We would absolutely stay there again the next time we visit Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: picabo56
Reviews.Content: Did alot of research for a very special trip with my 25 year old daughter. She flew in from Cincinnati (I live in Fort Myers, FL) and we drove down (5 hours on a good day)and arrived at the Banana Bay Motel at approx. 3:30 p.m. When we first pulled in to the parking lot, my heart sank to the floor, because at first glance it looked like a cheap roadside hotel. I had made reservations 2 weeks earlier and requested to be near a handicap spot, needed two queen beds, with the nicest view they could get. When we checked in, the young lady was working alone and was quite busy. She seemed almost robotic and my daughter didn't think she was that friendly. I think she was just busy, because she was alone working. I was really nervous, because I wanted my daughter to be very happy, since I had not seen her in a long time. She gave us a map of the premises and told us to drive all the way in the back by the swimming pool and that is where the surprise took place. It was just lovely in the back of the hotel. We got an excellent handicap spot right in front of the ramp going up to the room. There were two luggage carts available right there too. When we opened the door to the room....just beautiful. Nicely decorated with a Tommy Bahama theme, cute floor lamps with monkeys climbing on it. Very clean. Lovely balcony overlooking the pool and parking lot. Two very nicely made up beds with great pillows. (I usually bring my own pillows). A wet bar, an ice machine readily available. We put our bathing suits on and went down to the pool area. There was a jacuzzi and then a little beach area with very nice lounge chairs, hammocks and a lovely view of a bay. Non swimming beach, but lovely anyway. There was alot of shade trees and everything was immaculate. A giant outdoor chess board in the sand. One warning, this is tops optional and 18 and up only. A couple of gals went topless in the pool, doesn't bother me, but it may others. It was very quiet(off season)and when we got back from dinner that night (10:30) we put our suits back on and went down and sat in the lounge chairs and watched the stars. No one else was down there and I would think if it was just my husband and I, and not my daughter it would have been very romantic. There was no one in the pool, which was lit by soft blue lights and only one guy in the jacuzzi. The front desk clerk got us a taxi in 5 minutes (use the pink taxi company (forgot the name)and ask for Nicole as your driver, she was a hoot!) when we went to Mallory Square for the sunset earlier that evening. The reason why I was so impressed with Banana Bay was that 3 years earlier, my husband and I had stayed and the Comfort Inn in Key west and yes it was cheap then (July-off season $89.00) but it was also very dirty and the room was dark and dingy...almost like a smell of old beer and partying in it. The beds were awful etc. BANANA BAY IS MY NEW ECONOMICAL, CUTE HOTEL TO RECOMMEND IN KEY WEST. The room was a good value for $138. plus tax ($159.00 total) and I had looked at dozens and dozens of hotels, some running into the $500 range for one night (ridiculous). I would highly recommend this hotel also to honeymooners on a budget. It was a very pleasant surprise! Hope to go back soon with my husband. One thing to remember in Key West, it's a rock and I think there might be 2 little beaches for the public, so there are few hotels with the set up that Banana Bay had with the little beach and view of the bay. Hope this review helped you make up your mind where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great options for quite romantic time”
Reviews.Author: Karmamd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Banana Bay Resort in Key West in April for my honeymoon. The resort and the staffâ€™s service exceeded my expectations. Dana there helped me to make prior arrangements in decorating the room with flowers/rose petals and chocolate covered strawberries as a surprise for my wife upon check-in. They also provided me the room with the best view. Dana was so helpful that she kept in contact with me even on her day off to make these arrangements since my flight was delayed. The resort was peaceful and quiet, overlooking a bay. Continental breakfast every morning was also good. The staff at the front desk were courteous and helpful in answering questions and offering suggestions for local activities. We also took a dolphin/snorkeling excursion that left right from the resort. I would def recommend this resort for a nice quite time away from the loud noises of Duval street (which was just 5 minutes away by car).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option!”
Reviews.Author: Karolina516
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel May 08 - rooms are beautiful (ask for 2nd floor for best views), everything was very clean and staff friendly. It is located on the main road but you woudnt know it because the rooms are secluded. It is nowhere near Duval street and doesnt have the "old key west" feel, so you cannot walk anywhere but a cab to duval is about $10. It was nice to return to this little paradise after a night on Duval. I would definitely stay here again! Note - parking is free. Beach is great but not for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...But Not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: rpt59
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Banana Resort from April 28 to May 1. The room was very clean and large but the outside needs some updating. The front desk personnel were very nice and helpful with getting us a scooter and making snorkeling reservations. The pool was nice and so was the sunny beach. I do not know why it is called a resort since it is more like a motel. A few topless sunbathers but it is an adult only facility so no big deal and wife felt comfortable enough to join in. They do have a tiki bar but in the 4 days we stayed it never opened. I asked the front desk when the bar was going to open and it seems they forgot the bartender was scheduled for vacation that week and they did not arrange a replacement. Just a quick ride to Duval Street but too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best laid-back lifesyle”
Reviews.Author: mailmanillinois
Reviews.Content: We loved our vacation to Key West. We flew to Miami and drove down through the keys in a convertible, being from the Midwest, the sun felt so very warm and rejuvenating. Don't be in a hurry as this is a slow drive, but beautiful. We stayed at Banana Bay Resort. It was older but really quiet and had a great continental breakfast. The highlight for us was probably snorkeling at Big Pine Key. It took me awhile to catch on, but after that we wished we would have done it everyday at a different location. We will definitly go there again. Rented a 3 wheeled car to drive around. Had tons of laughs at our own expense as I was the reverse!! Duval street is really fun to sit and people watch as well as shop the unique gift shops. We had a wonderful time in the warm tropical environment and then we had to come back to ice and cold!

Reviews.Title: “More than I we ever expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: RalphMed
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect at first. I read positive and negative reviews from various hotel websites. Banana Bay Resort was my first pick due to the price and distance from all attractions. The resort was located on the main road and easy to get to. My wife and I were very surprised once we were inside the resort. The room was super clean and the view from our balcony was amazing. Surrounded by palm trees and great view to the pool and private resort beach. The whirlpool and the tiki bar was a surprise we didn't know about.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we Expected”
Reviews.Author: Wag54
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect having read both good and bad reviews before we left. Although the main office is right on US 1 and is not much to look at from the road, we were pleasantly surprised by the pool area and the large, clean rooms. We were fortunate to have an end room which overlooked both the pool and the ocean. Planned to stay only one night but stayed two. Read that this resort was "clothing optional" but never saw any evidence. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was good. Better value than hotels on the other side of US 1 as they do not have ocean side sunning beaches. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at Banana Bay”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Our plane was delayed so we missed our connection and ended up waiting stand by in the Atlanta Airport for 24 hours. We finally arrived in Key West 24 hours later then we planned, we were exhausted, it was nearly 10:00pm. We took a cab to the Banana Bay Resort, which we had already paid for, when I went to the front desk to check in I was told that because we had not called they gave our room to someone else (keep in mind we already paid for our stay) and they didn't have any other rooms available. I was told it was our fault for not calling and they would not refund our money from the 1st night and didn't have any place for us to stay. Thank goodness Expedia helped us out and got us another place to stay, they were very helpful. We still did not get any money back from the 1st night and had to pay extra for the hotel we ended up at.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could of asked for.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0706
Reviews.Content: We were at the resort the first week in January, had read a few dissapointing reviews so was not sure what we would find. It was great. The room was clean, staff friendly and very helpful. grounds were nice and the pool and hot tub were wonderful, not real big, but they were fine especially since there were not children running around. The continental breakfast was very nice. The front desk helped us find scooters to rent to get around the island, it was only a couple miles to duval street and nice to have quiet place to come back to and relax out of the hussle & bussle. My husband and I feel in love with Key West and will surely return, when we do we would deffinately stay at the Banana Bay Resort again. Pete & Paula Barth

Reviews.Title: “uh,, for the money not bad”
Reviews.Author: chris0576
Reviews.Content: I was there for 5 days. dec 16th-21st The rooms are ok, had a few mystry light switches, Flagged down the maid to ask her what they was.. She only spoke spanish. Beware of the nudie people. Seen 2 the entire stay. Its about a 5 minute drive any where on the island and realtivly secluded. The internet is painfully slow. So dont plan on a working vacation there. The beach isnt really a beach and the Pool bar was barely open. Seen it open twice in 5 days. If you just want a quite place to stay and dont plan on being in the room much this place should work. If you want all the bells and whistles go some where else. The price was excellent. $650ish for 5 days. most others was charging double that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: MARYSCHOEPP
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 4 night stay at the Banana Bay Resort in Key West. After reading some of the reviews I was nervous about staying here. HOWEVER, we loved it. Please know that this a clothing optional resort! This resort is not fancy, but perfect for the money. We loved the pool / hot tub area. The Tikki bar was perfect. I wish I got the bartenders name, but she made the best Bloody Mary's. They were perfect for sipping in the morning after a long night. The beach area is not for swimming but great for just sitting having a cocktail and watching the water. We thought the staff were very nice and friendly! The rooms were big, but the bathroom was on the small side. All the rooms had a a balcony. If you are looking for something fancy this is not the place- If you are looking for a fun, clean, inexpensive place while in Key West this is perfect! We met great people that were also staying there. We heard a few people say that they stay there every year. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good times and good people.”
Reviews.Author: KEYWESTJOE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort during the fantasy fest week and it was great the front desk staff was very helpful with instrutions about the hotels offerings, this is not a super delux resort but it's a great place for the price, This property is my replacment to the Atlantic Shores, (minus the flag and events). The morning breakfast was very filling, I enjoyed cooking my own waffels and nuking my oatmeal. The hottub was great after a long day of walking Duval it's under the palm trees and has the best jet action in south florida. One evening I sat in the hot tub and watched the sun's setting reflection aross the water as I looked over the sandy beach and watched two dolphins play about 50 feet off the dock. I was informed by the bartender the next day. that that was a rare event. The pool is not heated and is the most refreshing in Key West. A calm and mature type of guest stay here and the younger folks where 16 years of age or older. younge adults who are at least 16 should only stay here if they are the types that can enjoy the calm joy of just relaxing by the pool. The best thing about this hotel is that it is close to old town and has more to offer in size then a guest house, but is tucked away enuff to be off the radar of most tourist and away from the downtown noise with lots of its own nature setting.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation from Hell”
Reviews.Author: sunnymamma2007
Reviews.Content: I cannot express how disappointed my husband and I were with this hotel. From the very beginning we found the place had a run down look and were aprehensive about staying there. We had booked on line and were not aware that the room was on the second level. I have a problem with stairs so we requested a ground floor room. They granted the request and we moved our stuff to the new room the next day. This new room looked ok until my husband rememberd that he forgot something in the old room and called the desk about getting it and discovered that we were in the wrong room although the key opened the door and probably many others. We then moved our stuff to the right room and went out for the day. When we arrived back late that night we discovered that there were flying ants all over the room. It was after 10 p.m. and no one was at the office and we searched the place and found a worker at the restaurant who contacted somebody who came to the room and moved us again. This room also had some bugs but by then we were so tired that we stayed in the room until morning and then checked out earlier than we expected to stay. Also, all the rooms were in very bad condition with dirty rugs and bathroom fixtures that were rusty and broken lamp shades and bulbs. I don't recommend this hotel for anyone and can't imagine how they got a 3 star rating. It should be 1/2 star. I should mention that we paid the 3 day charge with my credit card and just recently was told by the credit card company that someone was using my card to charge stuff and so they had to cancel the card. It was done a few days after using the card at this hotel so it seems very strange to say the least. Please don't stay here people! It is a very bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Banana Bay resort”
Reviews.Author: SunloverCanada
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the office was a bit of a OH NO look, but after getting parked and walking along to the pool, hottub, beach area, tiki bar and man made beach, it was a bit of heaven..Our room was on the second floor, in my opinion the best room there, overlooking the Gulf of Mexico, the pool, beach, surrounded by palms, banana trees...The room itself was very nice, the service was excellent, a very nice complimentary breakfast, there is no restraunt on the property but there are mini kitchens in the rooms , plus we ate out alot anyways...It is close to Duval St. as Key West is very easy to get around..The staff was friendly, the people staying there were nice, it is a clothing optional resort, so....either like it or don't stay there..We will definately go again, the atmosphere was as being in the tropics not in the USA in a Mega hotal......If you want the RITZ and commercialism ....go somewhere else...This Banana BAy Resort is Perfect.....relaxing, quiet, and we were made to feel very welcome and comfortable....

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sisca
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel stay ever in my life. The pictures are on the website is deceiveful. It was our anniversary. Before we checked in we were so dissappointed looking at the actual hotel. This is a way different from what they described and from the website. We tried all other hotels but everything were fully booked. So we had no choice, finally checked in. My opinion this is NOT a hotel, This is a motel next to Taco Bell 1. Trashes are all over the ground. 2. Pool is filty and dirty water., towels were all over the place. 3. I got rash all over my body from the Dirty Water Spa. 4. There was NOT any nice beach, There were million big sharp stones that can cut your skin and beer bottles and trash all over the beach line. 5. TV didn't work, Called Front Desk. It was already closed and no body ever came to fix it. 6. Room had smell that i can't even describe what the smell about so we asked someone to come to give a refreshment spray and It took forever to have that person come to spray. The experience that we had was dissappoitment to another dissappoitment. In the morning when checked out there was not any Manager. The Front Desk promised will bring my complaint to the General Manager. But no body even ever got back to me, i even called the head in their corporate office in west palm beach. Still no response. Even my Bank couldn't even talk to hotel General Manager. They were very ignorance. I don't know how they run the bussiness. IT WAS VERY BAD EXPERIENCE. My suggesstion "DON'T EVEN THINK TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL". It was a night mare.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there under any circumstances!”
Reviews.Author: alloeric
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel at all cost. We had the worst experience of our lifes in this place. After the first night we actually asked to cancel the rest of the reservations and went looking for another place. Here is a list of the issues we faced: - Black stains on the mattress box. - We woke up with multiple red bites typical of bed bugs the next morning. - The decorative lace cover over the bed was covered by a layer of black dirt, and was ripped on both sides. - The TV was minuscule. - Black mold on one location on the wall. - Strong urine smell in bathroom likely originating from the brown stains inside the toilet bowl. - Dirty carpet. - Very expensive (50 % more than the nice guest house we ended up staying at). - This is basically a motel, not a hotel. The place is by the side of the main boulevard, before entering the city. - The place is next to the oceant, but there is no beach at all, only a stone wall along the shore. There are too many alguae to make it possible to swim. - The cleaning crew leaves their cleaning buggies full of dirty towels in the stairway during the day. - There is a large (20 feet) trash container next to the motel entrance in the courtyard. - The glass plate in the microwave was missing and there were many fruit flies and a nasty smell inside the microwave. - This is basically a dirty, trashy motel for the price of an expensive hotel. The place is by the side of US 1, before entering the city, and is built on two floors just like a cheap motel. Please, don't encourage flith, and do yourself a favor by choosing one of the larger hotel chains or one of the many nice guesthouses or bed and breakfast in the city center, where the people are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: SdenRI
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful. Spacious rooms, ours was intimate with the king size bed, and netting. Very clean. The pool area hasa tiki bar and is surrounded by lush foliage like the rest of the property. The hot breakfast buffet got us on our way quickly. We met a couple who has been coming here for 5 years straight. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Myrrhii
Reviews.Content: This cute, quaint small hotel resort is just the place I would choose had I seen it in person as opposed to booking it online. It is small (48 guestrooms), away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street (about 1 1/2 - 2 miles away but accessible by car, cab, bus, etc) friendly and clean! I read a few reviews that stated that it was "tired," "rundown," "past its prime," "dirty" etc. and I was quite honestly expecting the worst. We nearly drove right by the place, but I saw the Taco Bell....thanks to everyone who mentioned that! The front desk clerk was extremely friendly and helpful. The reception area was bright and tropical in color, in perfect Key West tradition. It appears that the buildings have been recently painted and there is a beautiful tropical mural in the main entry staircase to the two-floor complex. There was no garbage laying around that we noticed and the only "dirt" in the pool was occasional leaves that blew off the surrounding trees, but the maintenance guys were out there cleaning it regularly. Our room was wonderful and I had wireless access on my laptop from the room. We immediately checked out the pool area upon arrival, as this was the only picture I had ever seen online, and it was beautiful! The picture really doesn't do this place justice at all! All the lounge chairs have thick cushions and there are plenty, both around the pool and several out on the bulkhead beach area, as well as rocking chairs in the gazebo and along the bulkhead, and a hammock strung between the trees. The Tiki bar at the pool was open from 11am - 7 pm, and we had a wonderful bartender pampering us daily. The continental breakfast out by the pool each morning was wonderful. A nice touch. This is not an all-inclusive fancy schmancy resort. However, it is clean, comfortable, and a great Key West treasure. If it is the cookie cutter resort atmosphere you are looking for this hotel probably isn't for you. But if you want to experience the tropics in a quaint, quiet, tropical property, then give this great little place a try! We will definitely return to Banana Bay in the future and we'll bring and recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to this place?”
Reviews.Author: visit0r789456123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March and in May. We choose to come back in May because we liked it so much. This last trip was totally different. The front desk was so nice and friendly on our first visit. They were super accommodating and made up for the shoddy resort and lack of quality. This past visit in May was BAD and we will never go back. The front desk staff was rude and about as helpful as all the rocks on the beach. Don't even bother having them call for a cab. Our outside door did not lock, there was urine on the toilet when we checked in and leftovers in the fridge in the room. The housekeeper never came the second day until we called just to get more towels and was almost hostile the next day. Needless to say, the staff can make up for any other issues, but apparently this place has lost that. So sad.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it... very nice!”
Reviews.Author: felisleo98
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look like much from the outside but the property is large & wonderful on the inside! Very pretty room with a pool & gulf view. King bed with canopy. Very clean room & bath. Continental breakfast at the poolside tikki bar each morning was very nice. Morning paper left at the door. I spent my days sitting on a lounge under the palm trees reading a book, enjoying the gulf view. Private little sandy beach area, altho you cannot swim. But you can fish! Also, Smathers Beach is five minutes away by car or moped, so this was not a problem. Giant chess set -totally fun. Bike rentals available right on the property. Very close to pharmacy, grocery, etc. Friendly staff. 'Net access if needed. This place is a 5 minute or so drive to Old Town. You cannot walk it. Quite & peaceful at night for this reason! This is not a new resort but was well-kept & updated. It was perfect for our 4-day stay in Key West. I have no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassmaster11155
Reviews.Content: Having a great stay our company booked the rooms and the staff and hotel are faboulous great breakfast in the am and the hot tub is awesome. We are doing work at the Boca Chica Naval Air Station and after work the first place I head is the Hot tub. The Maids are great and everyone goes out of their way to make our stay a great one thanks so much to all.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: Raglan
Reviews.Content: Date November 2006 From Trip Advisor, Hampshire, England From prevoius reviews we expected the worst. However, yes the resort is tired looking and shows signs of the October 2005 storms but there are positive comments as follows:- The staff are friendly and willing to help at all times. The room was clean, large and had a great aspect. Included continental breakfast is excellent. Free parking is always a bonus in Key West. A few hundred thousand dollars and the place will be a five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesia2511
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical when reserving this hotel but still I felt like I was being drawn there. And I sure am glad that I was. Although it is an older hotel without all the fancy ammenities of some of the fancier hotels, I loved this place. The sunning beach was so beautiful. Right on the Gulf of Mexico. I had the beach to myself nearly everyday lounging in the sun or under the palm trees. Every morning a very nice continential breakfast was served beachside. I loved it. The staff was very nice and helpful too. So don't be fooled by the small picture that is shown on the website they really don't do it justice. The little beach alone sold it to me. It is away from town and you will need to take a cab which can be expensive but it was worth it. I loved my trip to Key West. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Things ain't what they used to be.......”
Reviews.Author: cfp17
Reviews.Content: We visited Banana Bay for the third time in April 2006. It had previously been a charming little hotel, with beautiful lanscaped grounds and friendly, helpful staff. What a difference this visit! The Tiki Bar was no longer operational, the fitness room had disappeared, the pool area was unkempt, many plants and trees had died off (but were still left in their pots), pool towels were in very short supply - and were still on the loungers next day, and bins around the pool were rarely emptied. Everywhere needed a coat of paint, and most of the staff were totally disinterested. Apparently the owner of the hotel had died, and the site was being sold for redevelopment. What a pity that this once relaxing haven has gone downhill so fast!

Reviews.Title: “Hated Banana Bay, Key West”
Reviews.Author: us2beachbums
Reviews.Content: It's called a resort but isn't! The rooms were slightly better than OK but the facilities were terrible. There was a pool but no pool side bar, it was there but was unstocked and unmanned. No restaurant to have lunch time snack or evening meal. Towels were left on sunbeds for 3 days without being moved and cleaned. Bins round the pool were not emptied in the 3 days we were there. There was potential for the beach at the back of the resort to be nice but litter was bad, included bottles, plastic cups and on one occasion, a used condom! The resort is also a taxi ride to the famous Duval Street of Key West. Not a pleasant stay and we do understand a lot of the facilities were damaged after Hurricane Wilma but until things have improved I can not recommend people stay there until better reveiws come back.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice when we were there!”
Reviews.Author: hoosiermama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2004. A bit off the main strip, but we didn't want to be right downtown anyway. We liked that there were no children allowed at this resort because, at the time, we didn't have children and didn't want to put up with anyone else's at the pool, as is often the case. It was quite, the rooms were dated, but the staff were friendly and it was a fair price. Take the bus when you can, cabs are ridiculous and the bus is very dependable. Recent reviews indicate that is may not be what is once was, but it was nice when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what is used to be.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 9 night stay at the Banana Bay. Very disappointing after staying there last year and two years previously to that. The hotel is very run down. Our room was in dire need of redecorating and when we checked in, we had to call reception to send a cleaner along! The Tiki Bar is no more, the pool was only cleaned of leaves etc twice in our stay and we had to keep asking for it to be done. The handyman was rude and miserable. The poolside rest rooms were out of order for our entire stay. We had to ask every day for pool towels. There was nobody to clean up round the pool at the end of the day and every morning there were empty beer cans etc still on the pool deck. There was no security at all and one night there were people in the pool at 4.45am!!! Another night a group of very noisy guests took over the disused bar and partied until 3.00am!!! The fire alarm went off one afternoon and not one member of staff was visable. We had to go to reception to find out that it was a false alarm. This could be a lovely hotel but it needs a change of attitude and management and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience - Bad attitude of staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Banana Bay was one of the choices of hotels for a catamaran trip 3 couples took from Fort Myers Florida to Key West. The reviews I read on Trip Advisor were all good so we were happy with our choice - WRONG. Here are some of the problems we encountered and the front desk staff responses in (). There were bugs in our room (gave us a can of smelly bug spray), 2 chairs on the lanai were rotted through (sent up new chairs after one of us fell when the leg fell off), the vending machines were empty ("Yeah, they have been out for some time now. There is nothing we can do, go to the liquor store a few blocks down the street"), the pool water was murky, the much advertised poolside Tiki Bar was not even open ("Yeah, we just got taken over by Hilton - I have no idea if it will ever be open again), Warning: "Sunning beach" in a brochure does not mean it has access to the water!! The place is run down and since the answer of the day was "Hilton just bought this place", it was clear the staff that we dealt with had no intention of making us happy customers. We will never go back to Banana Bay and since we live in Florida and frequent the Keys, this is unfortunate for them.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay only”
Reviews.Author: Suzy0163
Reviews.Content: Our stay started off okay. Rooms were clean, spacy. Some island bugs......but remember, your on an island. Lady at front desk was very nice and welcoming. Docking for snorkling, night cruising and flats fishing just steps away. The continental breakfast was very good. Besides the pool and the room, the outside needed a little attention, as far as cleanliness. The man working in the evening at the front desk was very helpful when we asked for good restaurants. Although, he was very nasty and rude when we lost our key and needed back in the room. He said he couldn't let us in until "he" got off at 10 p.m. He expressed that the keys were very rare and wasn't sure he could even get us in at all. This was "not" good. I have never encountered this situation in all my travels. We were then surprised again with total nudity at the pool. The ad didn't say "clothing optional". I mean "totally naked"......not just topless. It just said "adult exlcusive". We had reservations to dive one morning at Subtropic. Our dive was cancelled due to the loss of the boat captain..........very sad. He had died the night before in a very tragic accident (not scuba diving......just too tragic to talk about). Our hearts were very sad for this community of people that are so close. I want to put a great word in for Dive Key West. Eric and Jeremy were great with us and made our diving experience wonderful. They are very accomodating and professional. Also, you must eat at "Sarabeth's" on Simonton St. Great romantic restaurant with fabulous food and staff. Top notch, but the prices are very affordable. Banana Bay......good for a short stay only. Key West is a great island and friendly. We will go back but will find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not a three star”
Reviews.Author: osterhelix
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on our recent trip to Key West. The location is not great if you expect to walk to anything, but we had a rental car. Street parking is impossible, but you can park in a garage near the Duvall St. area for a small fee. This "resort" was average and perhaps a little overhyped. The front desk was not particularly friendly. Definitely ask for a pool-side room, not a room overlooking the parking lot. The beach is average. The pool and hot tub were just fine, but the pool-side bar left a little to be desired. The room was comfortable and had a nice porch, but it is not what I think most Americans are expecting in a three-star resort. It may have been three-star twenty years ago, but certainly is not now. Overall, an average place for an average price. If we go again, we will be getting a B&B near the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it's a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews. It's rated as a 3 star hotel, but that's not exactly right. The "higher level of service and amenties" isn't quite there. However, the bed was huge and the room was clean. We enjoyed the quietness of the hotel and its location. We'd recommend that you request a 2nd floor room, as the first floor is noisy. Someone else recommended a room away from the alley, that's also a pretty good idea. In the bathroom the wallpaper was peeling as well as the ceiling and the towels were thin and itchy. We didn't get a bath mat until the last night there. Just one indication of lack of higher level of service expected in a 3 star and above hotel. None of the rooms have screen doors and we were told that they were hard to keep intact. That was really too bad, since we were there when the evening weather was fabulous and a breeze without bugs coming in would have been nice. The continental breakfast was just fine following a busy evening. If you want a hotel close to everything this isn't it. It's 6 blocks from the edge of historic old town, but then it's several blocks into town, (restaurants, shopping) from there. Don't forget you have to walk back. We had a car, so we were able to take advantage of the parking garage and its daily parking. Additionally, the car was useful for traveling off the island. If you want a quiet place to stay that's clean and close enough to everything, then this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “tiki bar is a guy with a blender”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Florida Keys for our honeymoon and had planned to stay at this establishment. We were supposed to get the run of the house room, instead we received a smelly room, with a mediocre bed with only two pillows and the room looked like it had not been clean in months! We decided to check out the Tiki bar when we found that there is just some guy that can only make about 3 drinks with some drink mixes from Walmart and you can receive $1.50 cooler water. Also the resort is not in a secluded area but in the busy urban section of town across from Taco Bell. The continental breakfast is what drove us to another hotel. There were bugs crawling on the bagels as we poured warm milk over our cereal. If you want a nice romantic honeymoon I discourage you from going to this hotel and go to the Sheraton. We had a great experience there!

HotelInfo.Name: Banana Bay Resort - Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 2319 North Roosevelt Blvd, Key West, FL 33040
